messages.subject: dotcom shakedown???
messages.msgSnippet: thanks for the info ... I guess that s the downside of NOT watching tv, I miss these little tidbits ...  I just love Amazon.com, oh well ... Pris ... From:
messages.messageBody:
thanks for the info ... I guess that's the downside of NOT watching tv, I
miss these little tidbits ... I just love Amazon.com, oh well ...

Pris


----- Original Message -----
From: Cindy Ferguson <crma@...>
To: <Unschooling-dotcom@egroups.com>
Sent: Thursday, June 29, 2000 6:35 PM
Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] dotcom shakedown???


>
>
> Pris wrote:
> >
> > ahhhh mannnn, not Amazon??? what'd they say exactly??? ugh ... no,
CHANGE
> > is NOT always good ...
> >
> > Pris
> >
>
> Some analysts are predicting that Amazon will not meet revenue projections
> for the next quarter - my almost-3 year old was talking to me so I didn't
> catch all the details. I think this will affect their stock price more
> than anything else.
>
> From my point of view, Amazon is a good idea but its stock is not worth
> what it costs. Amazon is in a tough retail market and will never make a
> lot of money - if they did, someone else could come in and charge less
> for the same book, toy, record or whatever else they sell. Margins are
> not high in the retail sector until one has no competitors. One will
always
> have on-line competitors.
>
> I think the bubble of the dotcom euphoria is bursting on Wall Street.
It's
> about time to come back to earth!
>
> --
>
> Cindy Ferguson
> crma@...
>
> ------------------------------------------------------------------------
> Was the salesman clueless? Productopia has the answers.
> http://click.egroups.com/1/4633/14/_/448294/_/962322688/
> ------------------------------------------------------------------------
>
> Message boards, timely articles, a free newsletter and more!
